description.plain:
Zain Javadd “Zayn” Malik is an British singer and songwriter, and a former member of the boy band One Direction.

In 2010, Malik auditioned for the British television series The X Factor. After being eliminated as a solo performer, Malik was brought back into the competition, along with four other contestants, to form the group that would later be known as One Direction. During Zayn’s time in the band, they released four commercially successful albums, performed on a worldwide tour, and won several awards.

In March 2015, Malik’s representative announced the singer’s departure from the band, and Malik signed a solo recording contract with RCA Records. On November 17th, 2015, through an interview for The Fader, Malik teased the release of a new song, “Befour”, from his debut album Mind Of Mine. Lead single “PILLOWTALK” debuted at #1 on the Hot 100, becoming Zayn’s first number-one single. By reaching #1 in the US, it achieved something that One Direction never did—their best ranking was #2 with “Best Song Ever.”

songs.full_title: Dusk Till Dawn by ZAYN (Ft. Sia)
songs.title: Dusk Till Dawn

description.plain:
On “Dusk Till Dawn,” ZAYN enlists Sia on a song in which they tell the story of two lovers who are willing to do whatever it takes to stay together.

The song was released as a standalone single on September 8, 2017, delayed by one day. After releasing a few more singles throughout the following year, ZAYN then released his sophomore studio album, Icarus Falls, on December 14, 2018. On the same day, fans were confused as to why the song did not appear on the album. ZAYN claimed that there were issues while releasing the song as part of the album. On August 28, 2020, ZAYN re-released a new version of the album, in which the song, as well as his March 2017 single “Still Got Time” appeared.

The song was released on alongside its cinematic official music video. In the video, ZAYN portrays a secret agent, running from the law. He is accompanied by a mysterious female, portrayed by fellow British actress Jemima Kirke.

songs.full_title: PILLOWTALK by ZAYN
songs.title: PILLOWTALK

description.plain:
The debut solo release from former One Direction-er Zayn Malik, “PILLOWTALK” gets “dirty and raw” about sex—Malik explained to The Sunday Times:

Everybody has sex, and it’s something people want to hear about. It’s part of everybody’s life, a very BIG part of life! And you don’t want to sweep it under the carpet. It has to be talked about.

Malik’s lyrics focus on both the spiritual and physical elements of sex: the pleasure and the pain, the purity and rawness, “our paradise and our war zone.”

Going solo frees Malik from the restraints of a made-on-TV ensemble like One Direction:

I’m enjoying what I’m doing. I’m not censoring myself anymore, so I’m not tired. I love it.

“PILLOWTALK” premiered on January 29, 2016, the day after an interview with Beats 1’s Zane Lowe during which he previewed the song and other tracks on his debut solo album Mind Of Mine. It later debuted at #1 on the Billboard Hot 100.

songs.full_title: I Don't Wanna Live Forever by ZAYN & Taylor Swift
songs.title: I Don’t Wanna Live Forever

description.plain:
“I Don’t Wanna Live Forever” is a sultry ode about feeling like life is hopeless without an ex-lover, written for the Fifty Shades of Grey sequel, Fifty Shades Darker. The song is performed as a duet between music sensations ZAYN and Taylor Swift. Swift also co-wrote the song with producers Jack Antonoff and Sam Dew.

The track is Taylor Swift’s first release in 2016 besides singles from her fifth album 1989. Meanwhile, it’s one of many for ZAYN, who dropped his debut album Mind of Mine in March of that year.

Swift first revealed the track on her social media accounts, debuting the single art and a clip from the song on Instagram. Zayn later posted a photo on Instagram with Swift under the caption “#IDontWannaLiveForever.”

songs.full_title: Let Me by ZAYN
songs.title: Let Me

description.plain:
“Let Me” was Zayn’s first solo single of 2018 and his third since his debut 2016 album Mind of Mine, following the PARTYNEXTDOOR-assisted track “Still Got Time” and “Dusk Till Dawn” featuring Sia – apart from “wHo” from 2016’s Ghostbusters Soundtrack.

A music video, directed by Jose Padilha, was released at the same time as the track.

The song’s lyrics show Zayn trying to win a girl over with promises of a life of luxury and faithfulness.

songs.full_title: Entertainer by ZAYN
songs.title: Entertainer

description.plain:
“Entertainer” is Zayn Malik’s second 2018 single following the soothy track released back in April this year, “Let Me”, whose music video currently has 122 million views as of May 28, 2019 and the Top 20 debut on UK Singles Chart.

Malik released this new single on May 23, 2018 by a worldwide premiere on Beats 1 along with a next video on his official VEVO channel with a follow-up. Some of the clips have appeared on the trailer of previous single.

https://twitter.com/Beats1/status/998967490427305985?s=20

The track is about ZAYN’s experiences with a lover who also happens to be an entertainer. Sofia Jamora features in both the “Entertainer” and “Let Me” music videos, acting as the girl that ZAYN refers to in the songs. However, Jamora and Malik don’t have any history. Some speculate that Jamora was casted for the videos due to her strong resemblance to Gigi Hadid, who at the time was Malik’s ex-girlfriend. As of February 2020, Hadid and Malik are back together. As “Let Me” was about Gigi Hadid, it is a safe assumption that this is the same case with “Entertainer,” as the track is the sequel to “Let Me”.

songs.full_title: ​iT's YoU by ZAYN
songs.title: ​iT’s YoU

description.plain:
“It’s You” further strays from the sound of One Direction, leaning towards more R&B-influenced production from Malay, best known for his work on Frank Ocean’s channel ORANGE.

“It’s You” is the second release and first pre-order single from Zayn’s debut album, Mind of Mine—it was first performed on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon. This came as a surprise to many as his debut single was the expected performance.

The song was premiered by Zane Lowe on his Beats 1 Radio show before becoming available to purchase alongside the album’s pre-order on February 26, 2016.

songs.full_title: Better by ZAYN
songs.title: Better

description.plain:
ZAYN returns to the music scene with “Better,” his first and only release of 2020 and the lead single from his third studio album, Nobody Is Listening. Although he has done a few collaborations in 2019, it marks his first major release since his sophomore studio album, Icarus Falls, which was released in December 2018.

This song hints at his lover and model, Gigi Hadid, talking about giving second chances and finding a way back to love. It’s worth noting that she gave birth to their first child, a daughter, just a few days before its release. The chorus of it interpolates Kasey Cisyk’s 1997 song “You Light Up My Life.”

This song was initially found through a song repertoire two days before its release, on September 23, 2020. A few hours later, the singer confirmed its existence by posting video teases on social media, along with a link to the official music video, which was premiered.

songs.full_title: Still Got Time by ZAYN (Ft. PARTYNEXTDOOR)
songs.title: Still Got Time

description.plain:
“Still Got Time” is a song by singer-songwriter ZAYN, featuring PARTYNEXTDOOR. It was supposed to be the lead single from ZAYN’s second studio album, Icarus Falls, but it was later replaced by “Dusk Till Dawn”, which, in turn, was replaced by “Let Me”.

With sonic influences from Jamaican Dancehall, ZAYN joined forces with OVO’s own PARTYNEXTDOOR on this rythymic, upbeat piece as they croon to the young women, desperate to find love – instead encouraging them to let go and have fun. Announced by ZAYN on 3/21/17 through an Instagram post where he debuted the single’s cover art. He later tweeted a snippet of the instrumental.

Murda Beatz confirmed he produced the record with Frank Dukes.

songs.title: Tightrope

description.plain:
ZAYN sings about fully committing to a relationship on “Tightrope,” in which he shares his story about his relationship with model Gigi Hadid, who is also the mother of their daughter Khai. At first, he was hesitant that she kept testing him to see how far he can handle their relationship, but he became more confident and explains that is how trust is built.

In the post-chorus of the song, ZAYN interpolates Mohammed Rafi’s December 1960 single “Chaudhvin Ka Chand Ho” to admire the beauty of his girlfriend, singing in his second language of Urdu, as he has Pakistani descent from his father, Yaser Malik.

songs.full_title: A Whole New World (End Title) by ZAYN & Zhavia
songs.title: A Whole New World (End Title)

description.plain:
“A Whole New World” comes off the soundtrack for the remake of Aladdin (2019) by Disney. It’s a collaboration between ZAYN and American singer Zhavia Ward.

The song is a cover of the original which was released in 1992 and topped the Billboard Hot 100 as well as achieving a Grammy award for Song of the Year at the 36th Annual Grammy Awards, the first and so far only Disney song to win in the category.

Alan Menken, who composed the score and co-wrote songs for the original film, returned to compose the score of the remake and to co-write two new songs, as well as re-writing songs from the original film.

songs.full_title: Fingers by ZAYN
songs.title: Fingers

description.plain:
A slow-burning R&B ballad from ZAYN’s second solo album, “Fingers” is about a failed love that is paralyzing ZAYN, preventing him from even texting his lost love.

The song stands in stark contrast to his previous two, more dance-infused songs: “Sour Diesel” and the Timbaland-assisted “Too Much”.

songs.full_title: ​wRoNg by ZAYN (Ft. Kehlani)
songs.title: ​wRoNg

description.plain:
ZAYN teams up with R&B singer Kehlani for “wRoNg.” Kehlani is the sole featured artist on Mind of Mine. This is the first collaboration between ZAYN and Kehlani. Throughout the track, ZAYN and Kehlani sing about their sexual endeavours with their respective partners.

The collaboration was first announced during his Beats 1 interview with Zane Lowe. The song was “originally written as a rap song” before shifting it into a mid-tempo, R&B-influenced mellow ode to duplicity and communication in relationships.

The two have gushed about their mutual admiration, and Kehlani said of working with Zayn:

He’s one of the most talented people I’ve ever met and his album is about to be stupid crazy. It’s so tight, our song is super tight. I was just honoured that he chose me to be the feature of the project. It’s cool, I think we’re gonna build a lot, over time. He’s really dope.

songs.full_title: Vibez by ZAYN
songs.title: Vibez

description.plain:
“Vibez” marks ZAYN’s first release of 2021, serving as the second and final single to his third studio album,  Nobody Is Listening, which was only released exactly one week after the song.

On the song, the English singer-songwriter continues with his usual themes of sex. It is dedicated to American model Gigi Hadid, who is his girlfriend and the mother of their daughter. Using innuendos, he encourages her to show her true self and not having to hide anything since nobody else is there, which might also explain the album’s title.

The official music video for the song premiered only twelve hours after it, on January 8, 2021.

songs.full_title: Calamity by ZAYN
songs.title: Calamity

description.plain:
“Calamity” is the first song of ZAYN’s where he raps. It’s the only rap song on the album. You can hear his Bradford accent very clearly, contrary to his previous songs.

Nobody can be too sure of what this song really means. So far, you can kind of estimate that Zayn is feeling not in control, in a state of calamity, about life. Perhaps anxiety or overthinking, causing a feeling of oddness in the calamity. Feeling like he is just existing and not in control of his life or his relationships.

songs.full_title: Good Years by ZAYN
songs.title: Good Years

description.plain: “Good Years” is ZAYN’s second release after announcing his second album “Icarus Falls”. In the track, he details his anxieties of living a life in the spotlight and the regrets of the time spent there. This isn’t the first time he’s sung about his life as a One Direction heartthrob, in his 2015 track “rEaR vIeW” he reminisces people and thoughts from his past and present and details his struggles trying to bounce back from his departure from the group.

songs.full_title: BeFoUr by ZAYN
songs.title: BeFoUr

description.plain:
“BeFoUr” is the third promotional single from Zayn’s first solo album Mind Of Mine. It was released on March 17 2016.

The song was previewed in a behind-the-scenes video for his Fader cover story in November 2015 (this cover story was actually his first introduction as a solo artist).

“BeFoUr” examines Zayn’s life before leaving One Direction and was written in a studio in a Las Vegas hotel immediately after his departure from the band. In an interview with Entertainment Weekly,  Zayn talked about the inspiration behind the song which came during a Big Sean concert this same night

“We were sitting backstage in a VIP area and I was just telling him [Malay], ‘It’s crazy being here in Vegas. I’ve literally been all over the world with One Direction. I’ve done this before, but not like this. Not by myself, not this way, not here with the intention of working on my own music.”

The song title, “BeFoUr”, is obviously a pun. On the track, Zayn repeats several times the line “I’ve done this before”, addressing his career and incredible success with his former band One Direction.
When Zayn left One Direction, there were only four members left. Thanks to the title, the lyrics can be also interpreted as “I’ve done this, be four”, then referencing directly at the boy band.
Ironically enough, the last One Direction’s album Zayn appears on is titled “Four” (because it was their fourth LP).



In an interview for Cosmopolitan, Harvard’s Briggs-Copeland Lecturer in English and poet Josh Bell discussed the song lyrics, title and its pun. Somehow, Bell ended up finding a way of comparing Zayn to Irish poet and novelist James Joyce and the legendary English playwright William Shakespeare :

“Were there five band members, so that when Zayn left it made four? And if so, does that make the title, here, a pretty solid pun? As in, ‘before, we were five, but now that I’ve left, I be-four you?’ Beware … begone … befour. That’s not a bad pun at all, really. Someone once said, ‘He who would pun would pick a pocket,’ but I think that person was Samuel Johnson, and no one really reads him anymore. Shakespeare picked pockets. James Joyce did too. I’m kind of split on puns, myself, but either way: someone should get Zayn, James Joyce, and Shakespeare in the studio together as soon as possible.”

The music video for “BeFoUr” was released the same day as the album, March 25th.

songs.full_title: ​fOoL fOr YoU by ZAYN
songs.title: ​fOoL fOr YoU

description.plain:
One of the album’s quietest songs, the NME’s Gavin Hayes characterised the piano-driven “Fool For You” as “an unexpectedly Beatles-esque pop ballad,” comparing it to “In My Life.” Zayn said of his classic Beatles inspiration for the track:

I was listening to a lot of John Lennon the week I got that loop… And there was this one song I got addicted to, with Indian music at the front of it, sitar, and then it becomes, like, another song…

songs.full_title: Outside by ZAYN
songs.title: Outside

description.plain:
“Outside” serves as the third track off of ZAYN’s third studio album, Nobody is Listening. This calm guitar tune is solely produced by Charlie Handsome.

ZAYN reflects on a breakup with his partner.
He is determined to keep showing love and devotion, hoping that they can accept him back despite past troubles that the two faced.

The song was confirmed to appear on the album when ZAYN posted a trailer with snippets of all songs from the album on his 28th birthday and three days before its release, on January 12, 2021.

songs.full_title: ​dRuNk by ZAYN
songs.title: ​dRuNk

description.plain:
“dRuNk” was first previewed in a clip on Zayn’s Twitter on February 2, at which point the song’s title was assumed to be “Late Nights.” The track’s producer MakeYouKnowLove later posted the song title and an additional snippet on Instagram.

The relatively laid-back tune likens the buzz of love in a summer fling to the feeling of perpetual intoxication.

songs.full_title: There You Are by ZAYN
songs.title: There You Are

description.plain:
“There You Are” is ZAYN’s third promotional release after announcing his second studio album Icarus Falls. The song was released on Zane Lowe’s Beats 1 World Record three days before the official album release.

In the song, ZAYN talks about a special someone that has always been there for him, even when no one else was.

songs.title: Sweat

description.plain:
“Sweat” is the seventh track on ZAYN’s third album, Nobody Is Listening. ZAYN describes an intoxicating love he feels in a physical relationship.

Zayn has stated in an interview with Zach Sang that this song is a homage to Phil Collins' ‘In The Air Tonight’.

songs.full_title: LIKE I WOULD by ZAYN
songs.title: LIKE I WOULD

description.plain:
The third song to be released from Zayn’s debut solo album Mind of Mine, “LIKE I WOULD” is an upbeat, dancefloor-ready R&B jam. The song is a bonus track, and will appear on the deluxe version of the album.

Zayn first teased the song’s lyrics on Twitter before confirming its March 10, 2016 release. The song’s lyrics were met with immediate comparisons on Twitter to his former group’s 2012 song “I Would.”

songs.full_title: Too Much by ZAYN (Ft. Timbaland)
songs.title: Too Much

description.plain:
Marking their primary collaboration, ZAYN connected with legendary hip-hop producer and rapper, Timbaland for a sultry, almost futuristic R&B ballad. The notable, combined synths and drum beats may remind people of the rapper’s prior work. In the lyrics, a troublesome relationship is highlighted, where one clearly wants more than their partner does for things to work out between them.

An animated clip of the song was released on August 2, 2018. It begins with the side face shots of both artists, as shown on the single’s artwork. Then, those separate to show a repetitive sequence of the singer–seen with fuschia hair–dancing and moonwalking in front of a bouncing automobile.

songs.full_title: ​rEaR vIeW by ZAYN
songs.title: ​rEaR vIeW

description.plain:
“rEaR vIeW” picks the album back up after the intermission with a midtempo, guitar-and-electronics churn of lament.

Zayn titled this song “rEaR vIeW” because in this song he reminisces people and thoughts from his past and present. He’s essentially looking back in a, figuratively speaking, “rear view” mirror.

While the New York Times said the track “channels austere late-1980s-to-early-90s British R&B from Lisa Stansfield to Rick Astley,” “rEaR vIeW” also has clear influences from Frank Ocean, particularly in the double-tracked vocals on the song’s bridge.

Like much of Mind of Mine, the song’s lyrics have variously been speculated as being about One Direction as well as ex-fiancee Perrie Edwards.

songs.title: ​sHe

description.plain:
ZAYN described  “sHe” as a “party tune” that’s “not as intense lyrically” as some of the other cuts.

With its cool, slightly detached mid-tempo R&B vibe and romantic theme, “sHe” fits right in with the rest of ZAYN’s 2016 solo debut, Mind of Mine.

songs.full_title: INTERMISSION: fLoWer by ZAYN
songs.title: INTERMISSION: fLoWer

description.plain:
“INTERMISSION: fLoWer” (Urdu translation: وقفہ: پھول) combines a Pakistani folk sound with Urdu lyrics. This song marks Zayn’s first song released in Urdu, his father’s Native language.

The New York Times said “‘Flower’ is the most plainly besotted song on this album.”

Another, longer version of this song can be found when you dial 01121993 (Zayn’s birthday) on Malay’s website, which seems to be a teaser for the producer’s upcoming project, Booty Club.

songs.full_title: TiO by ZAYN
songs.title: TiO

description.plain:
“TiO” is a smooth R&B song by Zayn featured on his debut album, Mind Of Mine.

“TiO” is an abbreviation for ‘Take It Off’. “TiO” describes Zayn being so infatuated with his lover that he wants her to ‘take [everything] off". While this song is filled with sexually innuendos, it could be taken as Zayn’s lover finally feeling like she can show her true self and not have to hide behind anything, Zayn said in his eponymous autobiography,

…the original concept behind the song was a lot deeper. It was about wanting to see a girl for her true beauty, stripping off the layers of somebody you love and seeing them for who they truly are…

songs.full_title: Rainberry by ZAYN
songs.title: Rainberry

description.plain:
ZAYN questions himself on “Rainberry,” asking if his significant other, presumably his then-ex-girlfriend Gigi Hadid, is cheating.

Although ZAYN hasn’t specified what the term “rainberry” means, it could refer to the Gatorade flavour or Gigi Hadid.

ZAYN released “Rainberry” as a surprise on November 30, 2018. It serves as the first promotional single for Icarus Falls, which was released exactly two weeks after the song.

ZAYN released “Rainberry” as a surprise on November 30, 2018. It serves as the first promotional single for Icarus Falls, which was released exactly two weeks after the song.

songs.full_title: River Road by ZAYN
songs.title: River Road

description.plain:
“River Road” is the eleventh and final track on ZAYN’s third studio album, Nobody Is Listening. The track describes a sadness after being let down in a relationship and hoping for more. He also questions where his life will take him, while hoping for a better future and leaning on his significant other in those moments of despair.

On a March 2021 interview with The Zach Sang Show, Zayn revealed that he originally wrote “River Road” as a poem that he later turned to a song.

songs.full_title: Love Like This by ZAYN
songs.title: Love Like This

description.plain:
“Love Like This” is ZAYN’s return to the music scene after not releasing original material since his album Nobody Is Listening and his duet with Ingrid Michaelson, “To Begin Again,” both dropped in 2021. It also marks the singer’s first release under Mercury Records after separating ways from RCA Records in October 2021 amids the singer’s split with Gigi Hadid and legal battle issues involving Gigi’s mother, Yolanda Hadid.

Departing from the R&B sound of his last project, “Love Like This” embraces an upbeat UK Pop and Garage sound, with the theme revolving around entering a new commited and supportive relationship without worrying about the risks.

In anticipation to the song’s release, ZAYN made an appearance on the “Call Her Daddy” podcast, in which he described the song as:

A standalone song. It’s just a summer jam. It’s a good vibe. It just feels like summer."

A first preview of this new era was revealed through his Instagram in the last week of June, 2023, followed by a series of teasers throughout the week and the single announcement on July 14, 2023.

songs.title: BoRdErSz

description.plain:
“BoRdErSz” is the 11th track on ZAYN’s 1st studio album Mind Of Mine (Deluxe Edition). It’s a song about an intense and passionate relationship that is filled with risk and excitement. The song talks about a woman who is the life of the party, but is also dangerous and unpredictable. The woman is portrayed as someone who is always pushing boundaries, and the narrator is drawn to her because of this.
The relationship is intense but unpredictable, and the narrator is willing to take on all of the unknowns in order to experience the full depth and excitement of the relationship.

songs.title_with_featured: No Candle No Light (Ft. Nicki Minaj)

description.plain:
Diverging from ZAYN’s series of slow-burning, R&B jams, “No Candle No Light” introduces a more electronic-inspired sound for the British singer featuring rapper Nicki Minaj, who is no stranger to the electronic genre.

Rumours about the single first surfaced in early 2017 when fans claimed that ZAYN played the track at a listening party. ZAYN then confirmed that it exists in a September 2017 interview with Scott Mills on BBC Radio 1.

body.plain:
Diverging from ZAYN’s series of slow-burning, R&B jams, “No Candle No Light” introduces a more electronic-inspired sound for the British singer featuring rapper Nicki Minaj, who is no stranger to the electronic genre.

Rumours about the single first surfaced in early 2017 when fans claimed that ZAYN played the track at a listening party. ZAYN then confirmed that it exists in a September 2017 interview with Scott Mills on BBC Radio 1.

On November 13th, 2018 ZAYN posted a snippet of the long awaited collab on his Instagram story teasing the release on November 15th.

https://twitter.com/inZAYN/status/1062504544876167168

songs.full_title: I Won’t Mind* by ZAYN
songs.title: I Won’t Mind*

description.plain:
“I Won’t Mind” is a demo recorded by Zayn Malik that failed to make the cut for One Direction’s album Four. With the timing of its release coming less than a week after he announced his departure from One Direction on Facebook,  many speculated it to be his debut solo material.

Producer Naughty Boy surprised the world by tweeting out a link to the demo.
https://twitter.com/NaughtyBoyMusic/status/582728600610332672

This happened after Naughty Boy retweeted a video inferring he had saved Zayn’s life from the band. Unsurprisingly, Directioners were unhappy about this, as band member Louis Tomlinson started the attack back at the producer.

songs.full_title: Insomnia by ZAYN
songs.title: Insomnia

description.plain:
In a tireless cycle, “Insomnia” is the 24th song on ZAYN’s sophomore album, Icarus Falls.

 The song describes his endless wondering and hoping that his partner who left him will return. In the verses, he describes his “Insomnia” without this person. He makes clear that he feels as though his future is nonexistent without this person. In the chorus, he questions whether or not he is a fool for waiting for this person to return. He also describes making another “tune”, implying that this person who had left him is the same person that some of his other songs are about.

This song is thought to be about Gigi Hadid, Zayn’s (at the time) ex-girlfriend. Zayn at the time had an off-and-on relationship with Gigi, from 2015-2018. They had officially broken up in March of 2018, confirming the breakup over their social medias.

https://twitter.com/zaynmalik/status/973637458561650688
https://twitter.com/GiGiHadid/status/973640377839374337

They remained broken up until 2019, when their relationship allegedly was rekindled. In April 2020, TMZ reports that the couple is expecting their first child and on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, it was confirmed by Gigi.
Khai Malik, the couple’s first daughter, was born on Wednesday, September 23, 2020.

songs.full_title: SHE DON'T LOVE ME by ZAYN
songs.title: SHE DON’T LOVE ME

description.plain:
“SHE DON’T LOVE ME” is a semi-tragic story about unrequited love. Although Zayn would prefer to be in a relationship with this girl, she doesn’t truly love him. They still have sex, but it’s not the same.

In an interview with Complex, Zayn talked about the album:


C: What’s the breakdown of the album, in terms of love songs and pain or heartbreak songs?

Z: There’s a good ratio of both. There’s a lot of falling in love and a lot of falling out of love. It’s probably 60/40, falling out of love.


He certainly sings about falling in love here. She might not return his feelings, but at least he still gets (physical) intimacy with her.

songs.title: BLUE

description.plain:
Interpolating an acapella version of the Prelude from Bach’s “Prelude in C Major” for unaccompanied cello, the beautiful and meditative “BLUE” is Mind of Mine’s first bonus track, and one of the album’s most reserved moments.

A yearning reflection on regret and romance, the piano-driven ballad also features some of Zayn’s most extreme falsetto to date.

songs.full_title: PILLOWTALK (Remix) by ZAYN (Ft. Lil Wayne)
songs.title: PILLOWTALK (Remix)

description.plain:
For the remix of his #1 smash “Pillowtalk”, former One-Directioner ZAYN enlists Lil Wayne, a rapper well-known for both his songs about sex and chart success.

The resulting product might’ve been inspired from a line in the first verse, because it goes slow—slower than the original. It also includes new rap verses from both Wayne & Zayn, and the production is more sensual and seductive.

songs.full_title: When Love's Around by ZAYN (Ft. Syd)
songs.title: When Love’s Around

description.plain:
“When Love’s Around” is the first feature on the album Nobody Is Listening, with the emerging R&B star Syd. The American singer signed under Columbia Records delivers some smooth vocals, that goes flawlessly with ZAYN’s.

As for the lyrics, it almost feels like the formal version of the album’s second single “Vibez”, giving it the female point of view in this story.

songs.full_title: I Don't Mind by ZAYN
songs.title: I Don’t Mind

description.plain: In “I Don’t Mind”, Zayn has resigned to the idea of falling (most likely from the heights of fame and success that he achieved early on in his music career), back to earth to become grounded, before flying again on his own terms. This song depicts his fall as one of eventual triumph, as long as his lover is by his side throughout the experience.

songs.full_title: Imprint by ZAYN
songs.title: Imprint

description.plain:
Conveying his undying love and need for a person, “Imprint” is the 5th song on Zayn’s sophomore album, Icarus Falls.

This song is about being with a person and them being the focus of their life. The chorus explains how the relationship ended but Zayn is still in love with this person and wants them back with him.

This song is thought to be about Gigi Hadid, which Zayn had an off-and-on relationship with from 2015-2018. In March of 2018, they confirmed that they had broken up on social media.
https://twitter.com/zaynmalik/status/973637458561650688
https://twitter.com/GiGiHadid/status/973640377839374337
They spent the next few years apart while still being friends and occasionally seen together until 2020, where their relationship was thought to be rekindled. In April 2020, TMZ reports that the couple is expecting their first child and on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, it was confirmed by Gigi.

Khai Malik, the couple’s first daughter, was born on Wednesday, September 23, 2020.

songs.full_title: Satisfaction by ZAYN
songs.title: Satisfaction

description.plain:
In “Satisfaction” Zayn acknowledges his own insatiability and mourns how life’s circumstances hinder his happiness. A music video for the song was released on January 9, 2019. It was the fourth official music video from Icarus Falls, preceded by  “Let Me”, “Entertainer”, and “Sour Diesel”.

The song’s music video was directed by Bouha Kazmi and only features Zayn for a few frames before turning the visual narrative over to the lead actors who depict a harrowing story of doomed loved.

At the start of the video the viewer is also presented with lyrics from “INTERMISSION: fLoWer”, featured on Zayn’s first album, Mind Of Mine.

songs.full_title: What I Am by ZAYN
songs.title: What I Am

description.plain:
“What I Am” was released on March 15th 2024 and serves as the lead single for Zayn’s 4th studio album as a solo artist titled “ROOM UNDER THE STAIRS”, which is set to be released on May 17th 2024. The song was first previewed on March 6th in an instagram video where he talks about his upcoming album for the first time. The day after he announced the song’s title and its release date.
On the day of its release he wrote on an instagram post:

This song is the first release of a special project I’ve been working on for years.

songs.full_title: Scripted by ZAYN
songs.title: Scripted

description.plain: The song ‘Scripted 'seems to be a commentary on the music industry, and how scripted everything a public figure either says or does is. Zayn (who was in the spotlight from a young age ) would definitely have seen and had experiences with this type of thing. Along with a person’s words being planned out, the song seems to also talk about how the media and general public often do not know the full/true story. As for the musical elements the song has strong piano backing and dreamy guitar and bass, making it a unique and beautiful addition to the album.

songs.full_title: ​tRuTh by ZAYN
songs.title: ​tRuTh

description.plain:
In “tRuTh”, Zayn sings about his journey from boyband-singer to solo artist. It’s a well-known fact that Malik felt oppressed when he was still in One Direction. As he tells Complex Magazine:

That [authenticity] was something that was always underlying, and ended up as the main factor of me leaving in the end. It was about denying the authenticity of who I was, and what I enjoyed about music, and why I got into it. That was always there. It was one of the things that wasn’t going to go away, so I had to go away.

Not only was Zayn forced to make music he didn’t genuinely like, he was also forced to look and dress a certain way;

There were certain restrictions in terms of the way that we could come outside of that young teen boy look. Mainly my beard, honestly. I wasn’t allowed to keep it. Eventually, when I got older, I rebelled against it, and decided to keep it anyway. I also wanted to dye my hair when I was in the band, but I wasn’t allowed to.

songs.full_title: If I Got You by ZAYN
songs.title: If I Got You

description.plain:
Surviving in a foreign world and finding someone  who gets him, “If I Got You” is the 9th song on Zayn’s sophomore album, Icarus Falls. This song features a pop-R&B sound that is often present in his music.

This song uses space and alien metaphors to describe the feeling of not fitting in with the general population. Zayn finds another person who doesn’t fit in, or has also fallen from space. With this person, he doesn’t need to fit in with everyone else. This unnamed person is presumed to be Gigi Hadid, Zayn’s current girlfriend and mother to his only child, Khai Malik.

In the verses, Zayn describes never wanting to leave this person and he will go wherever this person wants to go no matter what. In the chorus, he solidifies the feeling of being an outcast and the euphoria he now has because he has found someone that makes him feel at home.

description.plain:
“Natural” is the second song on ZAYN’s sophomore album, Icarus Falls. It’s a very slow-burning lust-feeling song.

This song is about Zayn and his lover feeling so in place because of how naturally they fit and feel together. He then has word plays on all things nature within this song and makes analogies with him and his lover’s love.

songs.full_title: Alienated by ZAYN
songs.title: Alienated

description.plain:
Released on April 12th 2024, “Alienated” serves as the second single for Zayn’s album “ROOM UNDER THE STAIRS”. He announced the release date with an instagram video where he talks about its creative process:

“Alienated”. I wrote “Alienated” first, and that kind of helped me mold and shape the sound even for, like, the way I wanted to approach the sound of my own voice and sonic sound of everything else, like the guitars. I don’t even know what to call it genre-wise, because I don’t want to say country, because I don’t think it’s country. I think it’s like, my version of, like, blues. You can’t really put them in a genre. They are just influenced by other music, but it’s my version of it.

songs.full_title: Stardust by ZAYN
songs.title: Stardust

description.plain:
“Stardust” is the 7th song on the album “Room Under The Stairs”. Zayn has defined this song as the love on the album:

“Stardust is the love on the album. There’s a lot of sad themes in there about not necessarily being in love anymore and ‘Stardust’ is about that idea of love and the feeling that love gives you. The album needed a bit of ‘love injecting’.”

This song was presented with a video clip, both released on May 17 of 2024.

After the death of Liam Payne, Zayn Malik has dedicated this song to him in all of his shows so far. The song is displayed alongside a “Love you Bro” sign.

songs.full_title: GOLDEN by ZAYN
songs.title: GOLDEN

description.plain:
“Golden” is a song on ZAYN’s debut solo album, Mind Of Mine.

The song is the final track of the Target-Exclusive edition of the album— the definition of a soulful, piano-backed ballad.



ZAYN uses vivid imagery to spin a nostalgic tale, reminiscing about a lifetime of memories, and optimistic about the future for himself and all of his friends.

songs.full_title: You Wish You Knew by ZAYN
songs.title: You Wish You Knew

description.plain: “You Wish You Knew” is a song by ZAYN from his album “Icarus Falls,” which was released on December 14th 2018. The track features ZAYN’s signature smooth R&B style, showcasing his vocal range and emotional delivery. Lyrically, the song delves into themes of longing, introspection, and the complexities of relationships. ZAYN reflects on feelings of desire and the misunderstandings that can arise between partners. The production blends atmospheric elements with a melodic hook, creating a moody and immersive listening experience. Overall, the song captures the essence of yearning and the challenges of communication in love.

songs.full_title: Fresh Air by ZAYN
songs.title: Fresh Air

description.plain:
“Fresh Air” is a track from ZAYN’s 2018 album Icarus Falls. The song delves into the complexities of a strained relationship, expressing a desire for personal space and relief from emotional pressure. The lyrics convey feelings of entrapment and the need for a new perspective, with ZAYN wanting “some fresh air” as a metaphor for escape and renewal.  Musically, the track features fuzzy yet insistent drum-machine hits paired with a drowsy loop, underscoring the pressure-cooker lyrics that outline a relationship on the rocks.  “Fresh Air” showcases ZAYN’s ability to blend  introspective themes with contemporary R&B elements, contributing to the album’s exploration of love’s complexities.

songs.full_title: DO SOMETHING GOOD by ZAYN
songs.title: DO SOMETHING GOOD

description.plain:
The reggae-tinged “Do Something Good” is one of two Target-exclusive bonus tracks from Mind of Mine. It also shifts the stylistic precedent for song titling — whereas the album’s “main tracks” feature alternating capitalization (for example, “dRuNk” and “tRuTh”), and the bonus tracks are in all-caps (see “BLUE,” “LIKE I WOULD”) the Target bonus tracks are capitalized “normally.”

The song features a distinctive female backing chorus to augment the sharp horns weaving in and out of the riddim.

body.plain:
The reggae-tinged “Do Something Good” is one of two Target-exclusive bonus tracks from Mind of Mine. It also shifts the stylistic precedent for song titling — whereas the album’s “main tracks” feature alternating capitalization (for example, “dRuNk” and “tRuTh”), and the bonus tracks are in all-caps (see “BLUE,” “LIKE I WOULD”) the Target bonus tracks are capitalized “normally.”

The song features a distinctive female backing chorus to augment the sharp horns weaving in and out of the riddim.

songs.full_title: The Time by ZAYN
songs.title: The Time

description.plain:
In this song Zayn is reflecting on true love and the moments spent with her.
The Time appears to be a deeply personal reflection on the importance of authentic relationships and the value of love, over fame. It explores the themes of time, regret, personal growth, and the precious nature of intimate moments with a loved one. By expressing these sentiments, Zayn shares a message about prioritizing genuine human connections and emotional fulfillment over superficial achievements.

Furthermore,
Earlier in one song of “Nobody is Listening” album, there is instance Actors after BAFTAS Zayn puts his views that actors/creators/musicians are running after chasing the awards, instead of trying to give out their best and creating a best creative piece of their work.
